RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the patrol car: the United States Border Patrol's patrol car
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the pickup truck camper: Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck camper
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the window: the window of the patrol car
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.pickup truck camper: Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck camper
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the United States District Court in pick: the United States District Court in Maria De Jesus Garcia's case
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the stop on Interstate Highway 35: the investigatory stop on Interstate Highway 35
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the investigatory stop on Interstate Hig: the investigatory stop on Interstate Highway 35

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States Border Patrol's patrol: Vehicle used by agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron for surveillance and inspection
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Maria De Jesus Garcia's pickup truck cam: Vehicle used to transport undocumented immigrants, subject of a suppression motion and search, stopped over 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the window of the patrol car: Location from which Baron observed suspicious activity
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Baron's flashlight: Tool used to illuminate the interior of the pickup truck camper
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States District Court in Mari: Court that denied the extension motion for the suppression motion but allowed presentation of evidence
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the investigatory stop on Interstate Hig: Stop made by roving United States Border Patrol agents Stanley Pruszenski and Alfred Baron, subject to Brignoni-Ponce standard, occurring more than 100 miles from the United States-Mexican border
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the 5th Circuit Court of Appeals: Court that articulated the principles for determining the legality of stops made by roving patrol officers
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the United States-Mexican border: Border relevant to the determination of the legitimacy of stops made by Border Patrol agents, with a distance of over 100 miles to the stop location in this case
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.the Cotulla, Texas Border Patrol Station: Station relevant to the area in which the pickup truck camper was encountered
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Interstate Highway 35: Highway on which the investigatory stop was made, leading directly to the United States-Mexican border but passing through several towns before reaching the border
